topic.title: How-To Reach ZeroNet on non-localhost IP addresses?
topic.body: I'd like to be able to use a single of instance of ZeroNet on the LAN (192.168.1/24).  Is that possible?

2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: This is truly the next and possibly first and most decentralised, democratised information network ever.  It's scaling will be a test, but but it's so cool and peer to peer it makes me want to burst.  Everyone who joins brings their resources with them, in hardware, network, and content.   And what we like will flourish while the unpleasant will have their place but not in our faces.  Congratulations to the authors.

> [soralied](#comment_1_15ggsZXw23McyfXVx191y3G6C3dr12WUUd): OH GOD HOW DID I GET HERE

When I was drinking, I always asked that, specially when playing Quake II on line.

1_1Gi4g59DwnkjgL9VmvmrfC95tMymyWFaaY.body: If it's ignorant it may influence the ignorant.  That's all you need, credible grammar and no clue.  The unknown is always suspicious and easy to disparage.
